title: From Prosecutor to President: Yoon Suk-yeol Rides Wave of Discontent in South Korea
sub_head: The 61-year-old political neophyte morphed in just a year from progressive-party appointee to conservative leader
body:
SEOUL—A year ago, Yoon Suk-yeol wasn’t even a politician. He was South Korea’s top prosecutor, serving in the administration of left-leaning President Moon Jae-in.
Today Mr. Yoon is South Korea’s president-elect—having run atop the opposition party’s conservative ticket.
